articles.author: Alex Lawler, Olesya Astakhova, Maha Dahan
articles.description: The OPEC+ alliance of oil producers will consider additional production cuts for next year to support crude prices in virtual meetings on Thursday, three delegates told Reuters.
articles.title: OPEC+ ministers meet to discuss additional oil output cuts

articles.author: Akash Sriram, Hyunjoo Jin
articles.description: Tesla (TSLA.O) is set to start deliveries of its long-delayed Cybertruck electric pickup on Thursday, after CEO Elon Musk tempered investor expectations citing problems in ramping production of what he called a "radical" product.
articles.title: Tesla to deliver Cybertrucks after Musk tempers expectations

articles.author: Patrick Wingrove
articles.description: Novo Nordisk (NOVOb.CO) on Thursday said it sued one compounding pharmacy and refiled a lawsuit against another after finding their products claiming to contain the active ingredient for its in-demand weight-loss drug Wegovy were impure, some by as much as 33%.
articles.title: Novo Nordisk finds compounded Wegovy up to 33% impure, sues Florida pharmacies

articles.author: Samuel Indyk
articles.description: The euro fell on Thursday after euro zone inflation eased by more than forecast this month, fuelling bets of early European Central Bank rate cuts, while the dollar rose from a three-month low but was still set for its biggest monthly drop in a year.
articles.title: Euro zone inflation dents euro, dollar rises from three-month low

articles.author: Sheila Dang
articles.title: Elon Musk curses out advertisers who left X over antisemitic content

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's manufacturing activity contracted for a second straight month in November and at a quicker pace, an official factory survey showed on Thursday, suggesting more government policy support measures are needed to help shore up economic growth.
articles.title: China's factory activity contracts for second month in November

articles.author: Nell Mackenzie, Carolina Mandl
articles.description: After making hay when a summer bond rout propelled the U.S. dollar to 10-month highs, hedge funds are now pondering what lies ahead for the greenback.
articles.title: How hedge funds view the fate of king dollar

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem, Emily Rose
articles.description: International pressure grew on Israel and Hamas to extend a truce on Thursday after another exchange of hostages for Palestinian prisoners and humanitarian aid was delivered to the besieged Gaza Strip.
articles.title: Talks intensify to extend Israel-Hamas truce after more hostages, prisoners freed

articles.author: Kate Abnett, Katy Daigle, Valerie Volcovici
articles.description: As global leaders gather in Dubai for the world's U.N. climate conference, delegates hope to clinch an early victory on a disaster fund on Thursday before the summit turns its focus to fossil fuels and other divisive topics.
articles.title: COP28 summit opens with hopes for early deal on climate damage fund

articles.author: Jeff Mason
articles.description: The Democratic Party has no Plan B if President Joe Biden decided for any reason to halt his 2024 re-election campaign, and a sudden need to replace him as its standard-bearer would spark a messy intraparty battle.
articles.title: Democrats have no Biden backup plan for 2024, despite age concerns
